content: masonry mitts materials approx 140 yards of cascade 220 or another worsted-weight yarn either double-pointed needles or a 32 circular needle for magic-loop in size needed to get gauge i am a very loose knitter and used size 5 double-pointed or 32-inch circular needles one size down for ribbing stitch markers ruler or tape measure scrap yarn yarn needle gauge 5 5 stitches per inch in stockinette on larger needles directions co 32 on smaller needles and join in the round pm for start of round if desired k1 tbl p1 for 2 inches switch to larger needles and k12 pm k8 pm k to end of round pattern row 1 p to marker k to next marker p to end of round pattern row 2 k all stitches to end of round repeat pattern row 1 and 2 for 3 75 inches begin increasing for the thumb k or p depending on what is next in pattern to first marker sm k1 m1l k to 1 st before second marker m1r k1 sm k or p to end of round work 2 rounds in pattern with no increases between the markers continue increasing 2 st every 3rd round til you have 26 st between the markers divide for thumb work in pattern to first marker sm k6 slip 14 stitches onto scrap yarn for thumb k6 sm finish round in pattern you should have 36 st for the palm work in pattern no longer increasing between markers for another inch then switch to smaller needles remove markers and k1 tbl p1 for 4 rounds bind off work thumb on smaller needles pick up 14 stitches from scrap yarn knit these stitches then pick up and knit 4 stitches across the gap making sure to twist them knit another round plain up to your 4 picked-up gap stitches k2tog twice - this will close the gap 16 st k1 tbl p1 for 4 rounds then bind off and weave in ends repeat for second mitt ©vera brosgol 2014 free for personal use contact me if you want to sell them www verabee com
